titleStmt.title: Jenny's lamentation for the loss of her Jemmy. She wander'd up and down for love, till she was weary grown, then sate down in a shady grove, and thus she ma[d]e her moan. Tune of, Jenny Gin, or Busie fame.

Jenny's lamentation for the loss of her Jemmy. She wander'd up and down for love, till she was weary grown, then sate down in a shady grove, and thus she ma[d]e her moan. Tune of, Jenny Gin, or Busie fame.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in West Smithfield.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "A woe's me! poor harmless maid ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
